verses.verse: Do not boast <S%H1984><s%> about tomorrow, <S%H4279><s%> For you do not know <S%H3045><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> a day <S%H3117><s%> may bring <S%H3205><s%> forth. <S%H3205><s%>
Let another <S%H2114><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> you, and not your own mouth; <S%H6310><s%> A stranger, <S%H5237><s%> and not your own lips. <S%H8193><s%>

A stone <S%H68><s%> is heavy <S%H3514><s%> and the sand <S%H2344><s%> weighty, <S%H5192><s%> But the provocation <S%H3708><s%> of a fool <S%H191><s%> is heavier <S%H3515><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them.
Wrath <S%H2534><s%> is fierce <S%H395><s%> and anger <S%H639><s%> is a flood, <S%H7858><s%> But who <S%H4310><s%> can stand <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> jealousy <S%H7068><s%>?
Better <S%H2896><s%> is open <S%H1540><s%> rebuke <S%H9640><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> love <S%H160><s%> that is concealed. <S%H5641><s%>
Faithful <S%H539><s%> are the wounds <S%H6482><s%> of a friend, <S%H157><s%> But deceitful <S%H6280><s%> are the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of an enemy. <S%H8130><s%>

A sated <S%H7649><s%> man <S%H5315><s%> loathes <S%H947><s%> honey, <S%H5317><s%> But to a famished <S%H7457><s%> man <S%H5315><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> bitter <S%H4751><s%> thing <S%H4751><s%> is sweet. <S%H4966><s%>
Like a bird <S%H6833><s%> that wanders <S%H5074><s%> from her nest, <S%H7064><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> is a man <S%H376><s%> who wanders <S%H5074><s%> from his home. <S%H4725><s%>
Oil <S%H8081><s%> and perfume <S%H7004><s%> make <S%H8055><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%> glad, <S%H8055><s%> So a man's counsel <S%H6098><s%> is sweet <S%H4986><s%> to his friend. <S%H7453><s%>

Do not forsake <S%H5800><s%> your own friend <S%H7453><s%> or your father's friend, <S%H7453><s%> And do not go <S%H935><s%> to your brother <S%H251><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of your calamity; <S%H343><s%> Better <S%H2896><s%> is a neighbor <S%H7934><s%> who is near <S%H7138><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> a brother far <S%H7350><s%> away.
Be wise, <S%H2449><s%> my son, <S%H1121><s%> and make <S%H8055><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> glad, <S%H8055><s%> That I may reply <S%H7725><s%> <S%H1697><s%> to him who reproaches <S%H2778><s%> me.

A prudent <S%H6175><s%> man <S%H6175><s%> sees <S%H7200><s%> evil <S%H9567><s%> [and] hides <S%H5641><s%> himself, The naive <S%H6612><s%> proceed <S%H5674><s%> [and] pay <S%H6064><s%> the penalty. <S%H6064><s%>

Take <S%H3947><s%> his garment <S%H899><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he becomes <S%H6148><s%> surety <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger; <S%H2114><s%> And for an adulterous <S%H5237><s%> woman <S%H5237><s%> hold <S%H9111><s%> him in pledge. <S%H9111><s%>

He who blesses <S%H1288><s%> his friend <S%H7453><s%> with a loud <S%H1419><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%> early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> It will be reckoned <S%H2803><s%> a curse <S%H7045><s%> to him.
A constant <S%H2956><s%> dripping <S%H1812><s%> on a day <S%H3117><s%> of steady <S%H5464><s%> rain <S%H5464><s%> And a contentious <S%H4066><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> are alike; <S%H9586><s%>
He who would restrain <S%H6845><s%> her restrains <S%H6845><s%> the wind, <S%H7307><s%> And grasps <S%H7121><s%> oil <S%H8081><s%> with his right <S%H3225><s%> hand. <S%H3225><s%>
Iron <S%H1270><s%> sharpens <S%H9120><s%> iron, <S%H1270><s%> So one man <S%H376><s%> sharpens <S%H9120><s%> another. <S%H6440><s%> <S%H7453><s%>

He who tends <S%H5341><s%> the fig <S%H8384><s%> tree <S%H8384><s%> will eat <S%H398><s%> its fruit; <S%H6529><s%> And he who cares <S%H8104><s%> for his master <S%H113><s%> will be honored. <S%H3513><s%>
As in water <S%H4325><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> [reflects] face, <S%H6440><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> [reflects] man. <S%H120><s%>
Sheol <S%H7585><s%> and Abaddon <S%H11><s%> are never <S%H3808><s%> satisfied, <S%H7646><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> are the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> ever satisfied. <S%H7646><s%>
The crucible <S%H4715><s%> is for silver <S%H3701><s%> and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold, <S%H2091><s%> And a man <S%H376><s%> [is tested] by the praise <S%H4110><s%> accorded <S%H6310><s%> him.

Though <S%H518><s%> you pound <S%H3806><s%> a fool <S%H191><s%> in a mortar <S%H4388><s%> with a pestle <S%H5940><s%> along <S%H8432><s%> with crushed <S%H7383><s%> grain, <S%H7383><s%> [Yet] his folly <S%H200><s%> will not depart <S%H5493><s%> from him.
Know <S%H3045><s%> well <S%H3045><s%> the condition <S%H6440><s%> of your flocks, <S%H6629><s%> [And] pay <S%H7896><s%> attention <S%H3820><s%> to your herds; <S%H5739><s%>
For riches <S%H2633><s%> are not forever, <S%H5769><s%> Nor <S%H518><s%> does a crown <S%H5145><s%> [endure] to all <S%H1755><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%>

[When] the grass <S%H2682><s%> disappears, <S%H1540><s%> the new <S%H1877><s%> growth <S%H1877><s%> is seen, <S%H7200><s%> And the herbs <S%H6212><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> are gathered <S%H622><s%> in,
The lambs <S%H3532><s%> [will be] for your clothing, <S%H3830><s%> And the goats <S%H6260><s%> [will bring] the price <S%H4242><s%> of a field, <S%H7704><s%>

And [there will be] goats' milk <S%H2461><s%> enough <S%H1767><s%> for your food, <S%H3899><s%> For the food <S%H3899><s%> of your household, <S%H1004><s%> And sustenance <S%H9132><s%> for your maidens. <S%H5291><s%>
